alert.note: Alert for Ellsworth (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 11:38PM CDT until May 31 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Central Kansas, including the following counties, Ellsworth, McPherson, Rice and Saline. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1137 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to training thunderstorms. Flooding is expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salina, Marquette, Assaria, Smolan, New Cambria, Falun, Salina Airport, Kanopolis State Park, Kipp and Kanopolis Lake.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
